title: Rivian, FedEx, Cerner, Oracle: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Rivian is investing in a new production facility; Oracle is in talks to acquire Cerner
text:
* FedEx added 5.9% premarket. The company posted a 14% increase in revenue for its fiscal second quarter, as higher shipping rates helped offset rising costs from labor shortages.

* Cerner shares jumped 16% ahead of the bell. The Wall Street Journal reported that Oracle is in talks to buy the electronic-medical-records company, according to people familiar with the matter, a deal that could be worth around $30 billion. Oracle shares slipped 5.5% premarket.

* Robinhood Markets shed 1.3% premarket. JPMorgan clipped its price target for the popular trading app maker's stock to $17 from $26. It closed Thursday at $18.14.

* Bakkt Holdings added 1.9% premarket, but that's not much after the prior day's 34% loss for the crypto stock. The shares have been subject to large swings since the company went public in October, including more than tripling Oct. 25 on news of a Mastercard partnership.

* Johnson & Johnson slipped 2%. Health authorities said the rate of a rare but serious blood-clotting disorder associated with the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine is higher than previously detected.

* Steelcase shed 1.9% premarket after the office furniture maker warned that supply chain disruptions and inflationary pressures had crimped some of its growth.

* Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants slid 4.3% premarket after it reported earnings and said that its CEO Eugene Lee plans to retire in May but intends to stay on as chairman.

Chart of the Day

* Investors say Chinese authorities are likely to ease up somewhat on the embattled real-estate sector and to loosen monetary policy, helping support Chinese corporate borrowers more broadly.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Rivian, FedEx, Cerner, Oracle: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
